intro: Daucus communis var. allionii, commonly known as the Allion's cowparsley, is a biennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
